newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia weather seen turning drier.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia weather seen turning drier.

text.p: Weather conditions in Malaysia are expected to turn drier with the change in monsoon winds, the Metereological Services Department said on Tuesday.
It said the southwest monsoon was replacing the inter-monsoon period, resulting in fewer thunderstorms in the afternoon and evening.
The west coast states of Peninsular Malaysia may experience pre-dawn and early morning coastal rain, the department said.
The dryness will also lead to more "haze" or pollution in Kuala Lumpur, its neighbouring areas, and the northwest states of Peninsular Malaysia, the department added.
